{{Infobox organization |name = İçel Sanat Kulübü |bgcolor = |fgcolor = |image = İçel Sanat Kulübü, Mersin Province.jpg |image_border = |size = 250px |alt = |caption = Top: Müfide İlhan-Ayşe Uğural Gallery. Middle: Clubhouse. Bottom: Teoman Ünüsan Gallery |map = |msize = |malt = |mcaption = |abbreviation = |motto = |formation = |extinction = |type = |status = NGO |purpose = [[Art]] and [[outdoor recreation]] |headquarters = |location = Sanat Sokağı, [[Mersin]] |region_served = [[Mersin Province]], Turkey |membership = |language = Turkish |leader_title = |leader_name = Fatih Alkar (2012) |main_organ = |parent_organization = |affiliations = |num_staff = |num_volunteers = |budget = |website = {{URL|http://www.icelsanatkulubu.com}} |remarks = }} [[File:AKOB and ISK logos.jpg|thumb|300px|AKOB and ISK logos in a joint Project in Mersin]] '''Art Club of İçel''' ({{lang-tr|İçel Sanat Kulübü}}) is a nonprofit cultural organization in [[Mersin]], [[Turkey]]. [[İçel]] is the former name of [[Mersin Province]]. Founded in 1989, the club plays an important role in culturel life of Mersin.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.haberfx.net/isknin-20-kurulus-yildonumu-haberi-71283/ |publisher=Haber fx |title=Isk'nın 20. Kuruluş Yıldönümü |date=2009-08-26 |language=Turkish |accessdate=2011-04-02 }}</ref>
== Activities == *Each year, the club hosts conferences by celebrated academicians from various universities and literary circles of Turkey. It also hosts series of conferences on specific topics such as [[archaeology]], [[mythology]], [[philosophy]] etc. in collaboration with universities such as [[University of Mersin]], [[Istanbul University|University of İstanbul]] and [[University of Lecce]], [[Italy]]. *Two art galleries of the club serve supporting artists, sculptors and photographers.<ref name="c1">{{cite news |url=http://www.cumhuriyet.com.tr/?hn=138844 |newspaper=[[Cumhuriyet]] |title="Kilikya'nın vizöründen" fotoğraf sergisi |date=2010-05-10 |language=Turkish |accessdate=2011-04-02 }}</ref> *Frequently, concerts and poem performances are held in the main hall.<ref name="c2">{{cite news |url=http://www.cumhuriyet.com.tr/?hn=137772 |newspaper=[[Cumhuriyet]] |title=9. Mersin Uluslararası Müzik Festivali'ne doğru |date=2010-05-06 |language=Turkish |accessdate=2011-04-02 }}</ref><ref name="sh">{{cite news |url=http://www.spothaber.com/haber.asp?id=103733 |publisher=Spot aber |title=İşte Sanata ve Edebiyata DUuyaesızlığımızın Kanıtı |date=2011-01-23 |language=Turkish |accessdate=2011-04-02 }}</ref> Especially in summertime, some concerts are held in scenic rural areas around Mersin. *The members are informed about all kinds of cultural activities in Mersin via cell phones and internet. *Various art courses are offered to enthusiast amateurs including members and nonmembers of the club alike. *The club participates in annual [[Mersin International Music Festival|Music festival]] of Mersin.<ref name="c2"/>
==Outdoor recreation== The club organises weekend [[hiking]]s, and in some cases [[backpacking (travel)|backpacking]]. Non members are also invited. The track and the level of hiking difficulty is announced in advance by the group leaders. The groups are transported to an appropriate starting point, where they start hiking. The average hiking time is about seven or eight hours, excluding lunch time.
During hiking, the hikers enjoy picturesque [[Mediterranean Region|Mediterranean]] scenery and sometimes explore archaeological wealth that is quite widespread around Mersin. In past several times, the hikers informed the academic authorities about their findings like caves, ruins etc. Some antiques had been found during hikings and bestowed to [[Mersin Museum]].
== Media and international relations == The club publishes a monthly magazine. The essays are usually written by club members, and organized by the editorial board of the club. The emphasis is on the club activities, historical anecdotes about Mersin, examples of poetry and sometimes drawings.
The club has an internet website, at which all club activities are published. The club also distributes free e-mail addresses to members with club domain name.
The club sometimes participates in mutual projects with the art lovers of German city of [[Neustadt an der Weinstrasse]], which is a partner city of [[Yenişehir (Mersin)|Yenişehir]], a municipality of Mersin.
== Service buildings == [[File:Corasion ruins in Mersin.ext.jpg|thumb|300px|Hiking in Corasion, {{convert|70|km|mi|abbr=on}} west of Mersin.]] The club uses three old Mersin houses in the downtown that are aged more than a century and are situated is Sanat Sokağı ({{lang-en|Art Street}}). The street is a [[pedestrian zone]] and hosts street performances, handicraft displays and painting exhibitions.
;The Yellow House The 100 seat conference hall in the ground floor is named after Prof. [[Nevit Kodallı]], a well-known classical music composer, who was a citizen of Mersin. Minor concerts are also held in this hall.<ref name="c2"/> The top floor on the other hand is reserved for drama and music courses.
;The Green House The art gallery in the ground floor is named after [[Teoman Ünüsan]], a former governor of Mersin.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.kenthaber.com/akdeniz/adana/Haber/Genel/Normal/cukurovada-kultur-sanat/1b240504-a089-4944-8286-d2b240cbfc02 |publisher=Kent Haber Adana |title=Çukurova'da kültür-sanat |date=2006-12-28 |language=Turkish |accessdate=2011-04-02 }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.kenthaber.com/akdeniz/mersin/Haber/Genel/Normal/17--sergi-suna-pesenden/9683d803-524b-470a-bb67-925759feaf58 |publisher=Kent Haber Mersin |title=17. sergi Suna Pesen'den |date=2005-06-13 |language=Turkish |accessdate=2011-04-02 }}</ref> The administrative branches as well as the 3,000 book library is in the top floor.
;The Clubhouse The restaurant at the ground floor has a garden with century-old trees is quite attractive during summertime. The top floor is reserved for various activities. The small art gallery is named after [[Ayşe Uğural]] and [[Müfide İlhan]]. Müfide İlhan, a former mayor of Mersin, was Turkey's very first female mayor (in 1950-1951). At this floor, there are also rooms reserved for mountaineering, art courses, photography and folklore.<ref name="c1"/>
